thread.title: German SAP reports mixed second-quarter results
thread.title_full: German SAP reports mixed second-quarter results | MENAFN.COM

title: German SAP reports mixed second-quarter results
text:
(MENAFN) SAP reported mixed results as revenues exceeded forecasts on a surge in newer cloud software deliveries via the internet, pushing down profit to the lowest of forecasts, Gulf Times reported.

German business software maker said its second-quarter operating profit, excluding special items, increased 13 percent to USD1.5 billion, the bottom of estimation of between USD1.5 and USD1.57 billion.

Europe's largest software maker reported total revenue of USD5.38 billion, up 20 percent from USD4.5 billion, or 8 percent excluding currency effects. Analysts expected revenues of USD5.22 to USD5.39 billion.

Meanwhile, operating margin dropped to 28.0 percent from 29.8 percent a year ago. The decline reflected increased investments in SAP's newer cloud-based software services.
